page.title: 09COMMUNICATIONS IN TIDWORTH
page.content: We have a sub Post Office in the village with two deliveries a day. Most services can be obtained from this office. The Army also has its own postal service and communications network. The majority of homes have telephones. Telephone boxes are scattered around the village as are post boxes. A garrison magazine is produced monthly by the Royal Army Education Corps and local news comes from a selection of weekly newspapers. All the main daily newspapers are received by the newsagents but only one agent delivers house to house. He sends out 700 papers a day; a small proportion compared to the population. Other residents purchase their paper daily. Media coverage includes tele- vision and national and local radio. Videos,books and magazines also pro- vide information in our daily lives.
